intro: Ferocactus townsendianus, commonly known as the Townsend's barrel cactus, is a species native to the deserts of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its thick, ribbed stems that store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically clustered at the top of the stems. Its spines are modified leaves that help reduce water loss and provide protection from herbivores. Ferocactus townsendianus is adapted to full sun and well-draining soil, making it a hardy and resilient plant in harsh environments.
